verses.text: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said ,
Can a man be profitable unto God , as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?\f + \fr 22.2 \ft as he…: or, if he may be profitable, doth his good success depend thereon?\f*
\add Is it\add* any pleasure to the Almighty , that thou art righteous ? or \add is it\add* gain \add to him\add*, that thou makest thy ways perfect ?
Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment ? \p
\add Is\add* not thy wickedness great ? and thine iniquities infinite ?
For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought , and stripped the naked of their clothing.\f + \fr 22.6 \ft the naked…: Heb. the clothes of the naked\f*
Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink , and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.

But \add as for\add* the mighty man , he had the earth ; and the honourable man dwelt in it.\f + \fr 22.8 \ft mighty…: Heb. man of arm\f*\f + \fr 22.8 \ft honourable…: Heb. eminent, or, accepted for countenance\f*
Thou hast sent widows away empty , and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
Therefore snares \add are\add* round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;
Or darkness , \add that\add* thou canst not see ; and abundance of waters cover thee.
\add Is\add* not God in the height of heaven ? and behold the height of the stars , how high they are!\f + \fr 22.12 \ft height of the stars: Heb. head of the stars\f*
And thou sayest , How doth God know ? can he judge through the dark cloud ?\f + \fr 22.13 \ft How: or, What\f*
Thick clouds \add are\add* a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven. \p
Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden ?
Which were cut down out of time , whose foundation was overflown with a flood :\f + \fr 22.16 \ft whose…: Heb. a flood was poured upon their foundation\f*
Which said unto God , Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?\f + \fr 22.17 \ft for: or, to\f*
Yet he filled their houses with good \add things:\add* but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
The righteous see \add it\add*, and are glad : and the innocent laugh them to scorn.
Whereas our substance is not cut down , but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.\f + \fr 22.20 \ft substance: or, estate\f*\f + \fr 22.20 \ft the remnant…: or, their excellency\f* \p
Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace : thereby good shall come unto thee.\f + \fr 22.21 \ft him: that is, God\f*
Receive , I pray thee, the law from his mouth , and lay up his words in thine heart.
If thou return to the Almighty , thou shalt be built up , thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust , and the \add gold\add* of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.\f + \fr 22.24 \ft as dust: or, on the dust\f*
Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence , and thou shalt have plenty of silver.\f + \fr 22.25 \ft defence: or, gold\f*\f + \fr 22.25 \ft plenty…: Heb. silver of strength\f*
For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty , and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
Thou shalt also decree a thing , and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
When \add men\add* are cast down , then thou shalt say , \add There is\add* lifting up ; and he shall save the humble person.\f + \fr 22.29 \ft the humble…: Heb. him that hath low eyes\f*
He shall deliver the island of the innocent : and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.\f + \fr 22.30 \ft He shall…: or, The innocent shall deliver the island\f*
